tool_description: Converts metadata records between different schemas and standards, maintaining semantic integrity while adapting to target format requirements and field mappings.

source_record.description: The metadata record to be converted

source_schema.description: Source schema format: MARC, Dublin Core, MODS, EAD, or custom

target_schema.description: Target schema format: MARC, Dublin Core, MODS, EAD, or custom

mapping_profile.description: Predefined mapping profile or 'default' for standard mappings

preserve_extensions.description: Whether to attempt preserving schema extensions and custom fields

error_messages: Empty source record: Provide a valid metadata record for conversion
Unsupported schema combination: This source-to-target conversion is not supported
Invalid source schema: Use MARC, Dublin Core, MODS, EAD, or custom
Invalid target schema: Use MARC, Dublin Core, MODS, EAD, or custom
Mapping profile not found: Specified mapping profile does not exist
Conversion failed: Unable to complete schema conversion due to incompatible elements
usage: Provide source_record with its source_schema and specify target_schema for conversion. Use mapping_profile for specialized conversions and enable preserve_extensions to maintain custom elements when possible.

converted_record.description: The record converted to target schema format

mapped_fields.description: Array of fields successfully mapped to target schema

unmapped_fields.description: Array of source fields that could not be mapped

data_loss_warnings.description: Warnings about potential data loss during conversion
